intro: Linaria origanifolia subsp. rodriguezii, commonly known as Rodriguez's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's Mediterranean climate.
